header.title: orber_ifr

erlref.modulesummary: The Interface Repository stores representations of IDL information

description.p: This module contains functions for managing the Interface Repository (IFR). This documentation should be used in conjunction with the documentation in chapter 6 of 2.3. Whenever the term IFR object is used in this manual page, it refers to a pseudo object used only for interaction with the IFR rather than a CORBA object.

section.title: Initialization of the IFR
section.p: The following functions are used to initialize the Interface Repository and to obtain the initial reference to the repository.

func.name: init(Nodes,Timeout) -> ok
func.fsummary: Intialize the IFR

desc.p: This function should be called to initialize the IFR. It creates the necessary mnesia-tables. A mnesia schema should exist, and mnesia must be running.

func.name: find_repository() -> #IFR_Repository_objref
func.fsummary: Find the IFR object reference for the Repository

desc.p: Find the IFR object reference for the Repository. This reference should be used when adding objects to the IFR, and when extracting information from the IFR. The first time this function is called, it will create the repository and all the primitive definitions.

section.title: General methods
section.p: The following functions are the methods of the IFR. The first argument is always an #IFR_objref, i.e. the IFR (pseudo)object on which to apply this method. These functions are useful when the type of IFR object is not know, but they are somewhat slower than the specific functions listed below which only accept a particular type of IFR object as the first argument.

func.name: get_def_kind(Objref) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return the definition kind of the IFR object

type.v: Return = atom() (one of dk_none, dk_all, dk_Attribute, dk_Constant, dk_Exception, dk_Interface, dk_Module, dk_Operation, dk_Typedef, dk_Alias, dk_Struct, dk_Union, dk_Enum, dk_Primitive, dk_String, dk_Wstring, dk_Fixed, dk_Sequence, dk_Array, dk_Repository)

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind. Returns the definition kind of the IFR object.

func.name: destroy(Objref) -> Return
func.fsummary: Destroy, except IRObject, Contained and Container, target object and its contents

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind except IRObject, Contained and Container. Destroys that object and its contents (if any). Returns whatever mnesia:transaction returns.

func.name: set_id(Objref,Id) -> ok
func.fsummary: Set the target object's repository id

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Contained. Sets the repository id of that object.

func.fsummary: Get the most derived Contained object associated with the target object

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Contained. Returns the Repository that is eventually reached by recursively following the object's defined_in attribute.

func.name: describe(Objref) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return a tuple which describe the target object

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Contained. Returns a tuple describing the object.

func.name: move(Objref,New_container,New_name,New_version) -> Return
func.fsummary: Move the target object from its current location to given Container, name and version

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Contained. New_container is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Container. Removes Objref from its current Container, and adds it to New_container. The name attribute is changed to New_name and the version attribute is changed to New_version.

func.name: lookup(Objref,Search_name) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return the IFR object identified by the given name

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Container. Returns an IFR object identified by search_name (a scoped name).

func.name: contents(Objref,Limit_type,Exclude_inherited) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return the content of the target object limited by the given constraints

type.v: Limit_type = atom() (one of dk_none, dk_all, dk_Attribute, dk_Constant, dk_Exception, dk_Interface, dk_Module, dk_Operation, dk_Typedef, dk_Alias, dk_Struct, dk_Union, dk_Enum, dk_Primitive, dk_String, dk_Wstring, dk_Fixed, dk_Sequence, dk_Array, dk_Repository)

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Container. Returns the contents of that IFR object.

func.fsummary: Return a list of IFR objects matching the given name

type.v: Limit_type = atom() (one of dk_none, dk_all, dk_Attribute, dk_Constant, dk_Exception, dk_Interface, dk_Module, dk_Operation, dk_Typedef, dk_Alias, dk_Struct, dk_Union, dk_Enum, dk_Primitive, dk_String, dk_Wstring, dk_Fixed, dk_Sequence, dk_Array, dk_Repository)

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Container. Returns a list of #IFR_objects with an id matching Search_name.

func.name: describe_contents(Objref, Limit_type, Exclude_inherited, Max_returned_objs) -> Return
func.fsummary: Return a list of descriptions of the IFR objects contained by the target Container object

type.v: Limit_type = atom() (one of dk_none, dk_all, dk_Attribute, dk_Constant, dk_Exception, dk_Interface, dk_Module, dk_Operation, dk_Typedef, dk_Alias, dk_Struct, dk_Union, dk_Enum, dk_Primitive, dk_String, dk_Wstring, dk_Fixed, dk_Sequence, dk_Array, dk_Repository)
Return = list() (a list of tuples (contained_description records) | {exception, _}

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object of any kind that inherits from Container. Returns a list of descriptions of the IFR objects in this Container's contents.

For EnumDef: Members is a list of strings describing the enumerations. Sets the members attribute, which are the constituent parts of the exception.

func.name: get_mode(Objref) -> Return

func.name: set_mode(Objref,Mode) -> Return
func.fsummary: Set the mode of the target object (AttributeDef or OperationDef) to the given mode

desc.p: Objref is an IFR object the kind AttributeDef or OperationDef. For AttributeDef: Sets the read/write access for this attribute. Mode is an atom ('ATTR_NORMAL' or 'ATTR_READONLY'). For OperationDef: Sets the mode of the operation. Mode is an atom ('OP_NORMAL' or 'OP_ONEWAY').
